definition: a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]

sentences.english: When I please my boss, I am ass-kissing.
sentences.chinese: 当我讨上司欢心的时候，我是拍马屁。

sentences.english: Steve borrowed his dad's sports car to impress his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫借来他爸爸的跑车以讨得女友欢心。

sentences.english: She showed great skill in winning the hearts of the students.
sentences.chinese: 她在赢得学生欢心方面展露出高超的技巧。

sentences.english: He would like every man at this table to believe that he makes love to me .
sentences.chinese: 他是在让桌上的每个人都相信他在讨我的欢心。

sentences.english: If you want to win Tom's heart， make him a cheesecake.
sentences.chinese: 若是你想讨汤姆欢心，做起司蛋糕给他吃准没错。

sentences.english: "I cannot placate the Left, " he grumbles .
sentences.chinese: 他不满地说，“我没法讨得左派的欢心”。

sentences.english: I conciliated her with a promise to take her out to dinner.
sentences.chinese: 我答应带她去吃饭以讨她的欢心。

sentences.english: He tried to insinuate himself into the boss's favor.
sentences.chinese: 他设法巧妙地渐渐取得老板的欢心。

sentences.english: Wu chi chen had won my heart.
sentences.chinese: 吴起镇赢得了我的欢心。

sentences.english: To compliment excessively and often insincerely especially in order to win favor.
sentences.chinese: 尤指为了博得欢心的过分地且常常为不真诚地赞扬。

sentences.english: Jack insinuated himself into her favour.
sentences.chinese: 杰克曲意巴结，赢得了她的欢心。

sentences.english: She quickly sought to ingratiate herself with the new administration.
sentences.chinese: 她很快就试图使她自己获得新政府的欢心。

sentences.english: It was a contrast which recommended him most forcibly to her mother.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比很有说服力，帮他博得了她母亲的欢心。

sentences.english: The more she has to work for your affections, the more she'll be into you。
sentences.chinese: 她为讨取你的欢心做得越多，她就会爱你越深。

sentences.english: There was a kind of jubilation immediately afterwards.
sentences.chinese: 随后立刻出现了一种欢心鼓舞的气氛。

sentences.english: Tom:Well, he lost Marta. She doesn't love him any more.
sentences.chinese: 这个嘛，他失去了玛尔塔的欢心，她不再爱他了。

definition: to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
to adapt to sb's taste/to fit sb's fancy
to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
the affection, or heart, of a young woman
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
